import Mathlib.Data.Real.EReal
import Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Lebesgue.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.Bochner

import SBSProofs.Utils
import SBSProofs.PushForward
import SBSProofs.SteepestDirection

local macro_rules | `($x ^ $y) => `(HPow.hPow $x $y)

open scoped RealInnerProductSpace
open BigOperators Finset ENNReal NNReal MeasureTheory

set_option trace.Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite true
set_option maxHeartbeats 400000

/-
  We defined measures Î¼ and Ï€ (Î½ is considered as the standard Lebesgue measure) along with their densities (finite and non-zero on the entire space)
-/
variable {d : â„•}

variable [MeasurableSpace (Vector â„ d)] [MeasureSpace (Vector â„ d)] [MeasureSpace â„]

variable (Î¼ Ï€ Î½ : Measure (Vector â„ d)) (dÎ¼ dÏ€ : (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ)

/-
  Î¼ << Ï€ << Î½, they both admit density w.r.t. Î½.
-/
variable (_h1 : absolutely_continuous Î¼ Ï€) (_h2 : absolutely_continuous Ï€ Î½)
example : absolutely_continuous Î¼ Î½ := absolutely_continuous_trans _h1 _h2

variable (hÎ¼ : is_density Î¼ Î½ dÎ¼) (hÏ€ : is_density Ï€ Î½ dÏ€) (mdÎ¼ : Measurable dÎ¼) (mdÏ€ : Measurable dÏ€) (hdÎ¼ : âˆ€x, dÎ¼ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÎ¼ x â‰  âˆ) (hdÏ€ : âˆ€x, dÏ€ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÏ€ x â‰  âˆ)


variable [IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼] [IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€]

variable (h_m_set : âˆ€ (s : Set (Vector â„ d)), MeasurableSet s)

/-
  We define a RKHS of ((Vector â„ d) â†’ â„) functions.
-/
variable (Hâ‚€ : Set ((Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)) [NormedAddCommGroup ((Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)] [InnerProductSpace â„ ((Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)] [s : RKHS Hâ‚€]

def positive_definite_kernel := âˆ€ (f : â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„), (0 â‰¤ âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i in range (d + 1), f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ§ (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i in range (d + 1), f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼ = 0 â†” âˆ€x, âˆ€i, f i x = 0)

variable (h_kernel_positive : positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€)

/- We define the product RKHS as a space of function on â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) to â„ (vector-valued function in our Lean formalism). A function belongs to such a RKHS if f = (f_1, ..., f_d) and âˆ€ 1 â‰¤ i â‰¤ d, fáµ¢ âˆˆ Hâ‚€. -/
variable (H : Set (â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)) [NormedAddCommGroup (â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)] [InnerProductSpace â„ (â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)]

/-===============================KERNEL STEIN DISCREPANCY===============================-/
/-
Here, we prove that KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is a valid discrepancy measure and that Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼).
-/

/- dk : x â†¦ i â†¦ y â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± k(x, y) -/
variable (dk : (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/- d_ln_Ï€ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Î¼(x) / Ï€(x)) -/
variable (d_ln_Ï€ : â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/-
  Definition of the steepest direction Ï•
-/
variable (dÏ• : â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/- We will use this assumption only when the function is trivially integrable (e.g. derivative of integrable functions). -/
variable (is_integrable_Hâ‚€ : âˆ€ (f : Vector â„ d â†’ â„), Integrable f Î¼)


/-
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x) / Î¼(x))
-/
variable (d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/-
Simple derivative rule: if the derivative is 0 âˆ€x, then the function is constant.
-/
variable (hd_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : (âˆ€x, âˆ€i, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ (âˆƒ c, âˆ€ x, log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c))

/-
dÏ€' : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x)
-/
variable (dÏ€' : â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/-
Simple derivative rule: âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x)) * Ï€(x) = âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x).
-/
variable (hÏ€' : âˆ€x, âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x)


variable [Norm (Vector â„ d)]
/--
  Stein class of measure. f is in the Stein class of Î¼ if, âˆ€i âˆˆ range (d + 1), lim_(â€–xâ€– â†’ âˆ) Î¼(x) * Ï•(x)â± = 0.
-/
def SteinClass (f : â„• â†’ (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„) (dÎ¼ : (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ) := âˆ€ x, tends_to_infty (fun (x : Vector â„ d) â†¦ â€–xâ€–) â†’ âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (dÎ¼ x) * f i x = 0


/-
  Kernel Stein Discrepancy
-/
variable (KSD : Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„)

/--
KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = âŸªâˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼, PÎ¼ âˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼âŸ«_LÂ²(Î¼). We assume here that KSD is also equal to âˆ« x, âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x + dÏ• l x) âˆ‚Î¼.
-/
def is_ksd := KSD Î¼ Ï€ = (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x * s.k x x' * d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ§ (KSD Î¼ Ï€ = âˆ« x, âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (d_ln_Ï€ l x * (Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€) l x + dÏ• l x) âˆ‚Î¼)

/-
  KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is originally defined as â€–Ï•^â‹†â€–Â²_H, it is therefore non-negative.
-/
def is_ksd_norm := KSD Î¼ Ï€ = â€–Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€â€–
variable (ksd_nn : 0 â‰¤ KSD Î¼ Ï€)

/-
  Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€
-/
variable (hstein : SteinClass (Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€) dÏ€)

/--
  We show that, if Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€, KSD is a valid discrepancy measure i.e. Î¼ = Ï€ â†” KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = 0.
-/
lemma KSD_is_valid_discrepancy (hksd : is_ksd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD) : Î¼ = Ï€ â†” KSD Î¼ Ï€ = 0 :=

instâœâ¶: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼

    -- Make the `Set.univ` appears for using the density later.

hstein: SteinClass (Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€) dÏ€

    âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x + âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l x
h1: Integrable fun x => âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x

h2: Integrable fun x => âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l x
int_univ: âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d), âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l a * Ï• l a âˆ‚Î¼ =
  âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l a * Ï• l a âˆ‚Î¼
mul_dist: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d),
  ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (fun l => d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x) l =
    âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (fun l => d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x) l * ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x)
mp
âˆ« (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ,

  0
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] mul_comm:1000, d_ln_Ï€ x xâœ * Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ x xâœ *
      ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ xâœ) ==> ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ xâœ) * d_ln_Ï€ x xâœ * Ï• x xâœ

hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x

hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x
instâœ: Norm (Vector â„ d)
KSD: Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„
ksd_nn: 0 â‰¤ KSD Î¼ Ï€
hstein: SteinClass (Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€) dÏ€
hksd: is_ksd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD
Ï•:= Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€: â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„
h: Î¼ = Ï€
split_sum: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d),
  âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x + dÏ• l x) =
    âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x + âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l x
h1: Integrable fun x => âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x
h2: Integrable fun x => âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l x
int_univâœ: âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d), âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l a * Ï• l a âˆ‚Î¼ =
  âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€ l a * Ï• l a âˆ‚Î¼
mul_dist: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d),
  ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (fun l => d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x) l =
    âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), (fun l => d_ln_Ï€ l x * Ï• l x) l * ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x)
mul_comm: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), d_ln_Ï€ i x * Ï• i x * ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) = ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x * Ï• i x
int_univ: âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d), âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l a âˆ‚Ï€ = âˆ« (a : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l a âˆ‚Ï€
mp
âˆ« (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ x_1 in range (d + 1), dÏ€' x_1 x * Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ x_1 x âˆ‚Î½ +
    âˆ« (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * âˆ‘ l in range (d + 1), dÏ• l x âˆ‚Î½ =
  0


    -- Use the integration by parts on the right-hand side integral.

[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict_univ:1000, MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict Î½ Set.univ ==> Î½
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @add_right_neg:1000, âˆ« (x : Vector â„ d),
        âˆ‘ x_1 in Finset.range (d + 1), dÏ€' x_1 x * Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ x_1 x âˆ‚Î½ +

d_ln_Ï€_Î¼_eq_0: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0
c: â„
x: Vector â„ d
h: log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
frac_neq_zero: dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x â‰  0
dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x

x: Vector â„ d
h: log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
frac_neq_zero: dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x â‰  0
frac_finite: dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x â‰  âŠ¤
cancel_ln_exp: dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c)
dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x
d: â„•
instâœâ¹: MeasurableSpace (Vector â„ d)
instâœâ¸: MeasureSpace (Vector â„ d)
instâœâ·: MeasureSpace â„
Î¼, Ï€, Î½: Measure (Vector â„ d)
dÎ¼, dÏ€: Vector â„ d â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ
_h1: absolutely_continuous Î¼ Ï€
_h2: absolutely_continuous Ï€ Î½
hÎ¼: is_density Î¼ Î½ dÎ¼
hÏ€: is_density Ï€ Î½ dÏ€
mdÎ¼: Measurable dÎ¼
mdÏ€: Measurable dÏ€
hdÎ¼: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), dÎ¼ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÎ¼ x â‰  âŠ¤
hdÏ€: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), dÏ€ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÏ€ x â‰  âŠ¤
instâœâ¶: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼
instâœâµ: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€
h_m_set: âˆ€ (s : Set (Vector â„ d)), MeasurableSet s
Hâ‚€: Set (Vector â„ d â†’ â„)
instâœâ´: NormedAddCommGroup (Vector â„ d â†’ â„)
instâœÂ³: InnerProductSpace â„ (Vector â„ d â†’ â„)

H: Set (â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„)
instâœÂ²: NormedAddCommGroup (â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„)
instâœÂ¹: InnerProductSpace â„ (â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„)
dk: Vector â„ d â†’ â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„
d_ln_Ï€, dÏ•: â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„
is_integrable_Hâ‚€: âˆ€ (f : Vector â„ d â†’ â„), Integrable f
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼, dÏ€': â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„
hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x
instâœ: Norm (Vector â„ d)
KSD: Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ Measure (Vector â„ d) â†’ â„
ksd_nn: 0 â‰¤ KSD Î¼ Ï€
hstein: SteinClass (Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€) dÏ€
hksd: is_ksd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€ dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD
Ï•:= Ï•_ Î¼ Hâ‚€ dk d_ln_Ï€: â„• â†’ Vector â„ d â†’ â„
hâœ: âˆ« (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ,
    âˆ« (x' : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ i in range (d + 1), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x * RKHS.k Hâ‚€ x x' * d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x' âˆ‚Î¼ âˆ‚Î¼ =
  0
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼_eq_0: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0
c: â„
h: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] â† cancel_ln_exp:1000, ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) ==> dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @ENNReal.div_eq_inv_mul:1000, dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x ==> (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] mul_right_comm (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ (dÎ¼ x) (dÏ€ x):1000, (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÎ¼ x * dÏ€ x ==> (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÏ€ x * dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] ENNReal.inv_mul_cancel (hdÏ€ x).left (hdÏ€ x).right:1000, (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÏ€ x ==> 1
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @one_mul:1000, 1 * dÎ¼ x ==> dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @eq_self:1000, dÎ¼ x = dÎ¼ x ==> True
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™


    -- We show by cases that ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) = 1. If it is â‰  1, this implies a contradiction as dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x and âˆ«â» x, dÎ¼ x âˆ‚Î½ = 1.

[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @mul_one:1000, 1 * 1 ==> 1
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @eq_self:1000, 1 = 1 ==> True

h: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
dÎ¼_propor: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x
hc: ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) â‰  1
univ_eq_one_Î¼: âˆ«â» (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, dÎ¼ x * 1 âˆ‚Î½ = 1
univ_eq_one_Ï€: âˆ«â» (x : Vector â„ d) in Set.univ, 1 âˆ‚Ï€ = 1
neg
ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) = 1

hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d) (i : â„•), ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x

c: â„

h: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
exp_c_eq_one: ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) = 1
dÎ¼_propor: âˆ€ (x : Vector â„ d), dÎ¼ x = 1 * dÏ€ x

Î¼ = Ï€

Î¼ = Ï€

/--
  Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼). We proved that by showing that, if Î¼ = Ï€, Ï•^* = 0 and Ï•^* â‰  0 otherwise.
